definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: The students were parading for peace.
sentences.chinese: 学生们示威游行，要求和平。

sentences.english: The speaker incited the mob to demonstrate against the rising cost of living.
sentences.chinese: 演说者鼓动群众示威游行，抗议生活费高涨。

sentences.english: President Bush is often the target of anti-American demonstrations.
sentences.chinese: 布什总统常是反美示威游行的目标。
没人资助这些示威游行。

sentences.english: There were daily strikes and demonstrations, and buildings were on fire.
sentences.chinese: 每天都有罢工和示威游行，而建筑物都着火了。

sentences.english: The police were present at the demonstration in (full) force.
sentences.chinese: 警方派出大队人马在示威游行的现场戒备。

sentences.english: For the past two weekends, anti-Chinese protesters have demonstrated in Vietnam.
sentences.chinese: 在过去两周的周末，越南各地都有反中国的示威游行。

sentences.english: These were among the largest demonstrations since the 18-day revolution in January and February.
sentences.chinese: 这18天以来，在一月和二月革命的最大的示威游行。

sentences.english: The protests were the largest antiterrorist demonstrations in history.
sentences.chinese: 抗议活动是历史上最大的反恐怖示威游行。

sentences.english: It is the first serious clash after weeks of mass protests.
sentences.chinese: 这是在大规模示威游行数周后的第一次严重武力冲突。

sentences.english: There were also anti-Chinese demonstrations in Vietnam.
sentences.chinese: 越南还发生了反华示威游行。
